intro: Psychotria herzogii, commonly known as the Herzog's psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly in the Andean foothills. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It produces small, dark blue to black berries that are often used in traditional medicine. Psychotria herzogii is also notable for containing psychoactive alkaloids, similar to those found in other members of the genus.
